title: Photograph, View of the chancel and the altar of an unidentified church, 1904–13
title_raw: View of the chancel and the altar of an unidentified church
description:
Designed by Leon Dabo (1868–1960); for J. and R. Lamb Co.
Vertical rectangle: The chancel formed of a semicircular, detached arcade, of nine-pointed arches with windows of the same shape above them. The altar has a reredos with three canopies, center, left and right, with spires above, and an arcade between. Pulpit left, with a scalloped canopy and side altars far left and right. Mosaic aisle floor.

Same church as 1961-83-3.

tombstone.epitaph: Photograph, View of the chancel and the altar of an unidentified church, 1904–13. printed on sensitized paper. 1961-83-2.
